name: Sofitel Luxembourg Le Grand Ducal

reviews.text: Very upscale (at least more than I'm used to) hotel with an extremely polite and helpful front desk. My only complaints are as follows:
reviews.title: Excellent Service and

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - Some of the staff seems to be unaware of the idea of good customer service. Numerous times, I called room service to either order food or have my tray picked up and I was put on hold for several minutes without anyone even asking, "May I put you on hold?" Just dead air.... Each time, I hung up after a minute of no response.
reviews.title: Modern, clinical hotel. EXPENSIVE additions

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - Lack of free/cheap Internet connectivity is a rather gaping void as well.
reviews.title: Great hotel - but make sure you get a deal!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - And lastly, the mattress was a bit lumpy.
reviews.title: The best hospitality I've ever experienced during a hotel stay!

reviews.text: Other than what I mentioned above, everything was great. Excellent valet parking and pickup. Pricey, but delicious breakfast. Free water and soft drinks in the mini-bar, refreshed daily. I would probably stay here again on my next visit.
reviews.title: exceptional in Luxembourg

reviews.text: I paid a visit to Luxembourg during my stay in Brussels. I wanted a hotel within walking distance from the train station and the main attraction areas of the city since the plance was to spend only one night there. After checking out all the hotels of the area I decided finally to book on Sofitel Le Grand Ducal although initially it looked like an overpriced hotel.
reviews.title: A flawless 5* awesome hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I arrived by train, a bit tired and having my walking directions on hand. Entering the hotel was the first surprise. An amazing, very relaxed, atmospheric and revitalizing fragrance was all over the area. I took a deep, deep breath and contact the reception. What a welcome I thought! The smell was like heaven. Reception staff were very polite and discreet, friendly and efficient. In 10' I was already in my room having filed all the papers. I had booked a single room with breakfast for 137euros.
reviews.title: Quality Hotel in Luxembourg

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: More surprises were waiting for me. Having stayed in many Sofitels around the world, this one was highly above the rest 5* hotels. Arriving at 3rd floor via the trendy and high tech elevators with the changing colors, that incredible smell was still there. Opening the door of my room, my tiredness had been sent away. Great relaxing colors, atmospheric lighting sources, clever design solutions of the available space, architectural innovations, great wallpapers, soft carpet, awesome bathroom and shower and one of the best beds I've ever slept.
reviews.title: Perfect!
Sofitel Luxembourg.
reviews.text: I was really impressed by all the details of this great Sofitel and of course my room, which was not an executive or a suite. The selection of fabric, colors, the lighting choices of the room, the personal touch of an orchid at the bathroom, the TV with the ambient light, the Nespresso machine smartly hidden in the closet, the spot lights in the shower, the architecture of the shower itself, the complimentary VOSS bottle of water, the high tech selection of the porcelain and the cutlery were all there to give you a sense of luxury, exclusiveness and relax which you expect from boutique hotels but of much higher rack rates.

The hotel is very well situated in the city center and the view from the hotel is breathtaking. The old city is within walking distance although I had to take a different longer path since on January there were ice on the stairs which lead down the old city and could be dangerous for pedestrians.
reviews.title: Much better than the Kirchberg one

reviews.text: The Grand Ducal certainly gave me many key things I look for in a luxury hotel: A great location, superb views, hushed quiet, luxury bedding, hi-end bath, and a spotless room.
reviews.title: An Inspired and Immaculate Take on Modern Luxury

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms on the front of the hotel have wonderful views of the Petrusse Valley, the Grund, and the Old City, and I personally enjoyed the few minutes stroll from the hotel to the Old City across the bridge that connects the area near the train station to the Old City.
reviews.title: Luxery in Luxembourg

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As an FYI, the hotel is modern and the shower design is very open to the bedroom and may or may not be a comfortable option for you depending upon whom you are with, but I really liked it and appreciated both the rain shower and hand-held spray options.
reviews.title: I slept well...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was probably the most immaculate I've seen all year and was essentially scar, scuff, and stain free....something I appreciate yet find quite rare, even in 5-star properties.
reviews.title: Seamless Style meets Full-on Luxury creating the ideal 5-star Romantic Getaway!

reviews.text: As said in other reviews, the complimentary mini-bar is a nice feature....mine had 2 colas, 2 juices, 2 bottled waters, and 2 perriers, and I also really appreciated both the soft-close doors so many 5-star properties lack and the multi-speed fan settings for white noise, as they combined with a plush bed and quiet neighborhood to make for an excellent night's sleep.
reviews.title: Home away from home...great shower and amazing beds!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is ultra modern, small room with large shower jutting into the center of the room. If you are traveling with someone that you are not comfortable showering in front of, this is not the hotel for you. The bed was sagging and the mattress was sunken in on the sides - very uncomfortable. We were in room 618, perhaps the bed and the room layout was unique to that room. The toiletries were L'occitane - very nice. The restaurant was very pricey and the menu was geared to people with a palate with a preference for gourmet food. There is not much to do in Luxembourg, we were there two days, and my husband and I felt one day would have been plenty. The location of the hotel is not close to any restaurants. It is walkable to the town center, but the walk does get old, regardless of the beautiful scenery along the way.
reviews.title: Edgy Hotel - Sagging Bed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were planning on visiting the American Cemetery where General Patton is buried. Unfortunately, there is no bus service and we did not have a car. We contemplated walking as the cemetery is approximately 5-6 miles round trip, but our sore feet (from all the walking in Amsterdam and Berlin) along with the rain made us decide not to go.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel. Just get rid of the smoking in the bar!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We did take the City Tour Bus and the little train which was informative and interesting. If you do that, you've seen it all - about 2 hour trip.
reviews.title: Perfect location and stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here for a long weekend, and the hotel is generally excellent. Staff were helpful, room was spotless and the free mini-bar is a nice touch. Our rate included breakfast, which if not in the room price is a hefty 30 euros per person, but I must admit it is very, very good and a class above most hotels. We also ate in the top floor restaurant which has a spectacular view across the city. Again, not cheap, but the food was of a very high standard and the ambience very pleasant.
reviews.title: great room and breakfast
Very good - but not flawless
reviews.text: Next to the restaurant, again overlooking the city is a very nice lounge bar, but it was totally ruined for us by the fact that everyone seemed to be smoking. We moved twice, but the ventilation was terrible, and so was the air quality. With most US hotels and even most bars in Europe now seemingly smoke free, this was like walking into a time warp, and I cannot understand why such a high class hotel still allows this.

aka: Sofitel Lux Le Grand Ducal Hotel
description: Overlooking the Alzette and Petrusse Valleys, the luxurious Sofitel Luxembourg le Grand Ducal enjoys stunning views of the historic city centre. The hotel is at the centre of the Espace Petrusse complex, a short walk from major multinationals, embassies, major tourist attractions and shopping. On the top floor of the hotel is a high class restaurant serving gourmet cuisine prepared by a star rated chef.
